lessons.title: Basic Greetings
lessons.description: Learn how to greet people in English

lessons.title: Daily Routine
lessons.description: Learn vocabulary and phrases about daily activities

lessons.title: Food and Drinks
lessons.description: Learn vocabulary about food and beverages

lessons.title: Travel and Transportation
lessons.description: Learn about traveling and different modes of transport

lessons.title: First Time to Meet
lessons.description: Learn first time to meet through interactive video lessons.

reading.content: Alex. Hey. Hey. This is my friend Bob. He's from England. Oh, hey. Um, excuse me, okay? Sit down, please. What city in England do you come from? I come from London. Have you ever been there? No, I've never been. I hope to go someday. You can, if you have true desire. Have you been here a long time? I've been here for about seven years. How about you? Oh, I've been here all my life. Why have you stayed here such a long time? I've stayed here for many reasons. Stated for many reasons. Are you married? Yes, I am. Is your wife beautiful? Would you like to see a picture of my wife? That would be nice. Oh, she's very lovely. Is she from around here? Thank you. Yes, she is from here. Do you have any children? No, no children yet, but certainly in the future. Where do you work? I work at the newspaper. Wow, the newspaper. What do you do there? I am a reporter.

questions.question: Complete: "I am a _____."
questions.explanation: Bob works as a reporter at the newspaper.

questions.question: How long has Bob been here?
questions.explanation: Bob mentions "I've been here for about seven years".

questions.question: Is Bob married?
questions.explanation: Bob answers "Yes, I am" when asked if he is married.

questions.question: Complete: "She is very _____."
questions.explanation: The speaker describes Bob's wife as "very lovely".

subtitles.text: Paul, you're late again.
Sorry.
I never get up before 8.45.
That's late.
What time do you get up?
5 a.m.
That's early!
What do you do in the morning?
Well, after I get up, I usually make breakfast, take out the garbage, do the laundry, do
the laundry.
The laundry?
Yes.
Then I read the newspaper, check my e-mail, sometimes I take a nap.
You take a nap in the morning.
Just 15 minutes.
On Monday, Wednesday and Friday, I exercise, and on the other days I clean the house.
Then I take a shower, get dressed, put on my makeup, and go to work.
Wow.
You never sleep late.
On the weekends, I sleep till 6.
That's real.
You do laundry in the morning.
And the evening.
Why?
When do you do the laundry?
Usually in March and September.

videos.title: First Time to Meet Conversation
videos.description: A conversation about first time to meet
videos.transcript:
[00:00.000 --> 00:10.520]  Alex. Hey. Hey. This is my friend Bob. He's from England.
[00:10.520 --> 00:19.800]  Oh, hey. Um, excuse me, okay? Sit down, please.
[00:19.800 --> 00:23.920]  What city in England do you come from? I come from London. Have you ever been there?
[00:23.920 --> 00:31.920]  No, I've never been. I hope to go someday. You can, if you have true desire.
[00:31.920 --> 00:37.920]  Have you been here a long time? I've been here for about seven years. How about you?
[00:37.920 --> 00:42.920]  Oh, I've been here all my life. Why have you stayed here such a long time?
[00:42.920 --> 00:48.920]  I've stayed here for many reasons. Stated for many reasons. Are you married?
[00:48.920 --> 00:54.920]  Yes, I am. Is your wife beautiful? Would you like to see a picture of my wife?
[00:54.920 --> 00:57.920]  That would be nice.
[01:00.920 --> 01:07.920]  Oh, she's very lovely. Is she from around here?
[01:07.920 --> 01:12.920]  Thank you. Yes, she is from here. Do you have any children?
[01:12.920 --> 01:17.920]  No, no children yet, but certainly in the future. Where do you work?
[01:17.920 --> 01:23.920]  I work at the newspaper. Wow, the newspaper. What do you do there?
[01:23.920 --> 01:34.920]  I am a reporter.

subtitles.text: Alex. Hey. Hey. This is my friend Bob. He's from England.
Oh, hey. Um, excuse me, okay? Sit down, please.
What city in England do you come from? I come from London. Have you ever been there?
No, I've never been. I hope to go someday. You can, if you have true desire.
Have you been here a long time? I've been here for about seven years. How about you?
Oh, I've been here all my life. Why have you stayed here such a long time?
I've stayed here for many reasons. Stated for many reasons. Are you married?
Yes, I am. Is your wife beautiful? Would you like to see a picture of my wife?
That would be nice.
Oh, she's very lovely. Is she from around here?
Thank you. Yes, she is from here. Do you have any children?
No, no children yet, but certainly in the future. Where do you work?
I work at the newspaper. Wow, the newspaper. What do you do there?
I am a reporter.

quizzes.question: How do you say "Hello" in English?
quizzes.explanation: Both "Hello" and "Hi" are common greetings in English.

quizzes.question: What does "Good morning" mean?
quizzes.explanation: "Good morning" is used to greet someone in the morning.

quizzes.question: Complete: "Nice to ___ you"
quizzes.explanation: The correct phrase is "Nice to meet you".

quizzes.question: Is "Goodbye" used when leaving?
quizzes.explanation: Yes, "Goodbye" is used when saying farewell.

quizzes.question: Match the greetings:
quizzes.correctAnswer: Hello-Xin ch√†o,Good morning-Ch√†o bu·ªïi s√°ng,Goodbye-T·∫°m bi·ªát
quizzes.explanation: These are the correct translations.

quizzes.question: What do you do first in the morning?
quizzes.explanation: The first thing you do in the morning is wake up.

quizzes.question: Complete: "I ___ my teeth every morning"
quizzes.explanation: The correct verb is "brush" - "I brush my teeth".

quizzes.question: Is "take a shower" a morning activity?
quizzes.explanation: Yes, taking a shower is typically a morning routine activity.

quizzes.question: What meal do you have in the morning?
quizzes.explanation: Breakfast is the meal you have in the morning.

quizzes.question: Match the activities:
quizzes.correctAnswer: Wake up-Th·ª©c d·∫≠y,Brush teeth-ƒê√°nh rƒÉng,Have breakfast-ƒÇn s√°ng
quizzes.explanation: These are the correct translations for daily activities.

quizzes.question: Who is your father's brother?
quizzes.explanation: Your father's brother is your uncle.

quizzes.question: Complete: "My mother's mother is my ___"
quizzes.explanation: Your mother's mother is your grandmother.

quizzes.question: Is "cousin" a family member?
quizzes.explanation: Yes, a cousin is a family member.

quizzes.question: What do you call your father's father?
quizzes.explanation: Your father's father is your grandfather.

quizzes.question: Match the family members:
quizzes.explanation: These are the correct translations for family members.

quizzes.question: What is the main food in Vietnam?
quizzes.explanation: Rice is the main staple food in Vietnam.

quizzes.question: Complete: "I drink ___ every morning"
quizzes.explanation: Many people drink coffee in the morning.

quizzes.question: Is "vegetables" healthy food?
quizzes.explanation: Yes, vegetables are generally considered healthy food.

quizzes.question: What do you call liquid that comes from cows?
quizzes.explanation: Milk is the liquid that comes from cows.

quizzes.question: Match the food items:
quizzes.explanation: These are the correct translations for food items.

quizzes.question: What do you use to travel long distances quickly?
quizzes.explanation: A plane is used for long-distance travel quickly.

quizzes.question: Complete: "I need a ___ to board the plane"
quizzes.explanation: You need a ticket to board a plane.

quizzes.question: Is a passport required for international travel?
quizzes.explanation: Yes, a passport is required for international travel.

quizzes.question: What do you call a place where you stay during travel?
quizzes.explanation: A hotel is where you stay during travel.

quizzes.question: Match the transportation:
quizzes.explanation: These are the correct translations for transportation methods.

quizzes.title: Daily Routine Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your understanding of daily routine

questions.question: What time does Paul usually get up?
questions.context: Based on the conversation about daily routine
questions.explanation: Paul says "I never get up before 8.45" but then mentions "5 a.m." as his actual wake-up time.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: "I usually make breakfast, take out the _____, do the laundry."
questions.explanation: The correct word is "garbage" - taking out the garbage is a common morning routine.

questions.question: On which days does Paul exercise?
questions.explanation: Paul specifically mentions "On Monday, Wednesday and Friday, I exercise".

questions.question: Complete: "On the weekends, I sleep till _____."
questions.explanation: Paul says "On the weekends, I sleep till 6" (meaning 6 a.m.).

questions.question: What does Paul do after taking a shower?
options: Get dressed, put on makeup, then go to work
questions.correctAnswer: Get dressed, put on makeup, then go to work
questions.explanation: Paul's sequence is: "take a shower, get dressed, put on my makeup, and go to work".

quizzes.title: First Time to Meet Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your understanding of first time to meet

questions.question: Complete: "I am a _____."
questions.explanation: Bob works as a reporter at the newspaper.

questions.question: How long has Bob been here?
questions.explanation: Bob mentions "I've been here for about seven years".

questions.question: Is Bob married?
questions.explanation: Bob answers "Yes, I am" when asked if he is married.

questions.question: Complete: "She is very _____."
questions.explanation: The speaker describes Bob's wife as "very lovely".

quizquestions.question: What is the most common greeting in English?
quizquestions.explanation: Hello is the most common and universal greeting in English.

quizquestions.question: When do we say "Goodbye"?
quizquestions.options: ["When meeting someone","When leaving","When asking for help","When thanking someone"]
quizquestions.explanation: Goodbye is used as a farewell when parting from someone.

quizquestions.question: Which word shows politeness when making a request?
quizquestions.explanation: Please is used to make requests more polite and respectful.

conversationhistories.transcript: I'm so very sick so what can what can I do
conversationhistories.aiResponse: I'm sorry to hear that you're not feeling well! Make sure to rest, stay hydrated, and eat light, nutritious foods if you can. If your symptoms persist or worsen, it might be a good idea to see a doctor. Take care of yourself!
Hello! I'm doing well, thank you! How about you?
Hello! I‚Äôm doing well, thank you! How about you?
Hello! I'm doing well, thank you! How about you?
I‚Äôm all ears! What‚Äôs on your mind?

conversationhistories.transcript: I can learn English very well. I can.
conversationhistories.aiResponse: Absolutely! That positive attitude will take you far. Keep practicing, and you'll see great improvements!

conversationhistories.transcript: I want to learn English well so what can I do?
conversationhistories.aiResponse:
That's a great goal! Here are a few tips to help you improve your English:

1. **Practice Daily**: Try to read, write, or speak in English every day.
2. **Watch Movies/Shows**: Choose English films or shows with subtitles to improve listening skills.
3. **Read Books**: Start with easier books or articles, then gradually choose more challenging material.
4. **Speak with Others**: Find language partners or join conversation groups.
5. **Use Apps**: Language learning apps can make practice fun and interactive.

Remember, consistency is key! You're doing great by wanting to learn!
